pyPRISM.closure.ReferenceMolecularPercusYevick module¶

class pyPRISM.closure.ReferenceMolecularPercusYevick.ReferenceMolecularPercusYevick(C0)[source]¶

Bases: pyPRISM.closure.MolecularClosure.MolecularClosure

Reference Molecular Percus Yevick (R-MPY) closure

Warning

This closure is not fully implemented. It should throw an error if a user attempts to use it.

Mathematial Definition

\[\begin{split}c_{\alpha,\beta}(r) = & \omega_{\alpha,\alpha}(r)*c^0_{\alpha,\beta}(r)*\omega_{\beta,\beta}(r) + \\ & \omega_{\alpha,\alpha}(r)*[(\exp(-u_{\alpha,\beta}(r)) - 1.0) (1.0 + \gamma_{\alpha,\beta}(r))]*\omega_{\beta,\beta}(r) \\ \gamma_{\alpha,\beta}(r) = & h_{\alpha,\beta}(r) - c_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\end{split}\]

Variables Definitions

  • \(A*B\)
    Convolution integral between A and B
  • \(h_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\)
    Total correlation function value at distance \(r\) between sites \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).
  • \(c_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\)
    Direct correlation function value at distance \(r\) between sites \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).
  • \(c^0_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\)
    Referene of Direct correlation function value at distance \(r\) between sites \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).
  • \(\omega_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\)
    Intra-molecular correlation function value at distance \(r\) between sites \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).
  • \(u_{\alpha,\beta}(r)\)
    Non-hardcore portion of Interaction potential value at distance \(r\) between sites \(\alpha\) and \(\beta\).

Description

TBA

References

Schweizer, K.S.; Yethiraj, Arun; Polymer reference interaction site model theory: New molecular closure for phase separating fluids and alloys, The Journal of Chemical Physics 98, 9053 (1993); doi: 10.1063/1.464465

calculate(gamma, omega1, omega2)[source]¶

Calculate direct correlation function

Parameters:
  • gamma (np.ndarray) – array of \(\gamma\) values used to calculate the direct correlation function
  • omega1,omega2 (np.ndarray) – array of \(\omega_{\alpha,\alpha}\) or \(\omega_{\beta,\beta}\) values used to calculate the direct correlation function
